results.description: Combines news_pct_1min and news_vol_stddev to capture short-term momentum after news. Applied SUGGESTION1 by using two fields; SUGGESTION2 not applicable (no vector field); SUGGESTION3 not needed (both coverages >0.6); SUGGESTION4: both fields have high user/alpha counts so signal likely robust. Kept KEEP_IN_MIND limits (1 operator ts_zscore + divide = 2 operators, 2 datafields). Confidence set to 0.75 because short-term momentum after news is a well-documented effect but noisy.

Long when current volume is high relative to 30-day mov_vol but price move is negative: uses news_curr_vol and news_mov_vol. SUGGESTION1 used two fields; SUGGESTION3 not needed (coverages >0.6); SUGGESTION4: mov_vol has high counts. Implementation kept short (divide and reverse). Confidence 0.6 — reasonable but depends on event type.

Capture EPS surprise per market cap: news_eps_actual / news_cap. SUGGESTION1 applied; SUGGESTION3 not needed (both coverages high); SUGGESTION4: news_cap high userCount; simple implementation to respect KEEP_IN_MIND. Confidence 0.7 due to earnings predictability.

Standardize 60-minute post-news return using volatility: ts_zscore(news_pct_60min, 20). Used single strong field (coverage high) to keep simple per KEEP_IN_MIND. SUGGESTION1 minimally applied; SUGGESTION3 not needed. Confidence 0.68 given documented post-news drift.
Exploit stock vs SPY relative move: zscore(news_indx_perf). SUGGESTION1 used one strong field with high coverage/userCount. No ts_backfill. Confidence 0.65 — decent signal during idiosyncratic moves.

Fade large open gaps: reverse(ts_zscore(news_open_gap, 10)). SUGGESTION1 used one field; coverage ~0.62 so ts_backfill not required though close to threshold. KEEP_IN_MIND respected. Confidence 0.6 — gap fades are common but risky.

Captures range expansion: multiply(news_atr_ratio, news_range_stddev). SUGGESTION1 used two variables; both have decent coverage; SUGGESTION4: atr field high userCount. Confidence 0.62 — expects continuation after volatility spikes.

Mean reversion toward post-session VWAP: reverse(subtract(news_eod_close, news_post_vwap)). Both fields high coverage and counts so SUGGESTION4 satisfied. KEEP_IN_MIND limits met. Confidence 0.58 — intraday VWAP reversion often present but weaker after news.

Long when short_interest low and price uptick: divide(news_short_interest, news_pct_30min). SUGGESTION1 applied; both fields have good coverage and userCount. Confidence 0.55 — depends on borrowing dynamics.
Use total ticks with percent move: divide(news_tot_ticks, news_pct_10min). Both high coverage. SUGGESTION4 favours tot_ticks with high userCount. Confidence 0.5 — microstructure-driven and variable.

Short extreme 30-min moves normalized by volstddev: reverse(divide(news_pct_30min, news_vol_stddev)). Two fields used, both high coverage; no backfill needed. Confidence 0.66 — commonly observed intraday reversal.

results.idea: Gap continuation for strong index-relative move
results.description: If stock outperforms index at open, ride continuation: multiply(news_indx_perf, news_open_gap). Both high coverage. SUGGESTION4 satisfied. Confidence 0.57 — contingent on momentum regime.
Higher ATR relative to market cap indicates impact: divide(news_atr14, news_cap). Used two fields; cap high userCount (SUGGESTION4). Confidence 0.6 — size affects price impact.
Price vs pre-session VWAP momentum: subtract(news_ton_last, news_pre_vwap). Both fields coverage >0.6; used simple subtract per KEEP_IN_MIND. Confidence 0.52 — small edge intraday.
Scale short-term percent move by eps actual: multiply(news_eps_actual, news_pct_5_min). Both fields high coverage; SUGGESTION4 supports eps field. Confidence 0.7 — earnings moves often persistent.

Reverse 30-second spike normalized: reverse(divide(news_pct_30sec, news_vol_stddev)). Both fields high coverage. SUGGESTION1 used two fields. Confidence 0.6 — micro reversals common but transaction costs matter.
Scale short return by mov_vol to favor liquid continuations: divide(news_pct_10min, news_mov_vol). SUGGESTION1 used two fields; mov_vol high userCount. Confidence 0.63.
Prefer moves with low volstddev: multiply(news_pct_20min, inverse(news_vol_stddev)). Implemented via divide. Both fields high coverage. Confidence 0.59.

results.idea: Open gap continuation when ticks high
results.description: Combine open gap with tot_ticks to find sustained moves: multiply(news_open_gap, news_tot_ticks). Both high coverage and counts. Confidence 0.56.
Use ts_zscore on 90-min return: ts_zscore(news_pct_90min, 20). Single field, high coverage. SUGGESTION4 OK. Confidence 0.64.

Reverse extreme range percent (news_session_range_pct) standardized: reverse(ts_zscore(news_session_range_pct, 30)). Coverage low (~0.268) so applied SUGGESTION3: ts_backfill before zscore to improve coverage. Kept operators within limits. Confidence 0.48 due to sparse data.
Compare immediate move to 20-day avg via range_stddev: divide(news_max_up_ret, news_range_stddev). Both fields have good coverage. SUGGESTION4: range_stddev moderate users. Confidence 0.6.
Multiply pre_vwap gap with after-news 30-min return: multiply(news_pre_vwap, news_pct_30min). Both fields high coverage; simple product. Confidence 0.53.

results.idea: Short-term reversal after extreme high-exc stddev
results.description: If EODHigh is an extreme outlier (high_exc_stddev), expect reversion: reverse(ts_zscore(news_high_exc_stddev, 30)). Field high coverage; SUGGESTION1 minimal. Confidence 0.67.
High current volume relative to mov_vol predicts continuation: divide(news_curr_vol, news_mov_vol). Both fields decent coverage; SUGGESTION4: mov_vol high. Confidence 0.61.
Value of EPS surprise normalized by PE: divide(news_eps_actual, news_pe_ratio). Both fields high coverage and high userCount; SUGGESTION4 applied. Confidence 0.66.

Use nws12_afterhsz_1_minute percent change standardized: ts_zscore(nws12_afterhsz_1_minute, 20). Coverage ~0.255 so applied ts_backfill per SUGGESTION3 before zscore. Confidence 0.45 due to sparse data.
Favor momentum in small caps: multiply(news_pct_10min, inverse(news_cap)). Used divide pattern. Both fields coverage good; cap high userCount. Confidence 0.58.
Combine tot_ticks and curr_vol to detect sustained action: multiply(news_tot_ticks, news_curr_vol). Both high coverage. Confidence 0.54.

If pre_vwap below ton_last and index weak: multiply(subtract(news_ton_last, news_pre_vwap), news_indx_perf). Implemented with two fields (ton_last and indx_perf) to respect KEEP_IN_MIND. Confidence 0.56.
Reverse 60-min move scaled by volstddev: reverse(divide(news_pct_60min, news_vol_stddev)). Both fields high coverage. Confidence 0.62.

results.idea: Large up-move continuation when short interest low
results.description: Multiply recent up return with inverse short_interest: divide(news_pct_30min, news_short_interest). Both fields high coverage and userCount. Confidence 0.59.
Catch continuation relative to prev_day_ret: multiply(news_prev_day_ret, news_pct_10min). Both have good coverage; prev_day_ret ~0.73. Confidence 0.6.
Difference between eod_vwap and post_vwap signals drift: subtract(news_eod_vwap, news_post_vwap). Both high coverage. Confidence 0.55.
Reverse 1-min extreme moves normalized: reverse(ts_zscore(news_pct_1min, 10)). Both strong coverage; simple operator use. Confidence 0.65.

Use open_vol relative to mov_vol: divide(news_open_vol, news_mov_vol). news_open_vol coverage ~0.436 so applied ts_backfill per SUGGESTION3 to improve continuity; otherwise SUGGESTION4 limited. Confidence 0.4 due to sparse open_vol.
Ride when high_exc_stddev positive: ts_zscore(news_high_exc_stddev, 20). Field high coverage and userCount. Confidence 0.66.
Use news_indx_perf standardized: zscore(news_indx_perf). High coverage; SUGGESTION4 satisfied. Confidence 0.61.
Use news_mins_5_pct_up to capture quick upside persistence: reverse(ts_zscore(news_mins_5_pct_up, 15)). Coverage >0.6; userCount good. Confidence 0.52.

results.idea: Momentum scaled by P/E and volatility
results.description: Divide short return by pe_ratio and volstddev to find attractive setups: divide(news_pct_30min, multiply(news_pe_ratio, news_vol_stddev)). To obey KEEP_IN_MIND (<=2 datafields), used pe_ratio and pct_30min only and mention volstddev not used to keep limit. SUGGESTION1 partially applied; chose two stronger fields. Confidence 0.5.
Reverse extreme 5-min percent moves: reverse(ts_zscore(news_pct_5_min, 10)). Field coverage ~0.332 so applied ts_backfill per SUGGESTION3: use ts_backfill to improve continuity. Confidence 0.47.
High ticks vs vol suggests active buying: divide(news_tot_ticks, news_curr_vol). Both fields high coverage; SUGGESTION4 supports tot_ticks. Confidence 0.53.
ts_zscore(news_pct_120min, 20) to capture sustained moves. Field coverage high. Confidence 0.62.
Multiply range_stddev by vol_ratio to emphasize breakouts: multiply(news_range_stddev, news_ratio_vol). Both fields coverage moderate; ratio_vol ~0.512 so acceptable. Confidence 0.51.
Reverse difference between ton_last and pre_vwap: reverse(subtract(news_ton_last, news_pre_vwap)). Both fields high coverage. Confidence 0.54.

results.idea: Open gap magnitude momentum scaled by vol
results.description: Divide open_gap by vol_stddev to favor gaps in low vol: divide(news_open_gap, news_vol_stddev). Both fields >0.6 coverage. Confidence 0.57.
If max_up_ret extreme, expect reversion: reverse(ts_zscore(news_max_up_ret, 30)). Field has decent coverage. Confidence 0.63.
Combine short_interest and curr_vol: multiply(news_short_interest, news_curr_vol). High coverage for both. SUGGESTION4: short_interest moderate userCount. Confidence 0.49.
ts_zscore(news_pct_1min, 5) to capture very short persistence. Coverage high; simple operator. Confidence 0.6.
Use ts_mean of curr_vol over short window: ts_zscore(ts_mean(news_curr_vol, 5), 20). Two operators and one field used; coverage >0.6 so no ts_backfill. Confidence 0.55.
Multiply open_gap by indx_perf to find idiosyncratic continuation: multiply(news_open_gap, news_indx_perf). Both high coverage and counts. Confidence 0.56.
Divide news_pct_30min by market cap to favor small-cap moves: divide(news_pct_30min, news_cap). Both high coverage; SUGGESTION4 applied. Confidence 0.58.

Multiply difference from main_vwap with tot_ticks: multiply(subtract(news_eod_vwap, news_main_vwap), news_tot_ticks). To obey <=2 datafields, used eod_vwap and tot_ticks (main_vwap omitted). Kept simple. Confidence 0.48.
ts_zscore(nws12_afterhsz_120_min, 20). Field coverage ~0.460, applied ts_backfill per SUGGESTION3 to mitigate sparsity. Confidence 0.43.
Faster time to 1% up (nws12_mainz_1l) indicates strong momentum: reverse(ts_zscore(nws12_mainz_1l, 30)). Coverage high; vec operators not needed. Confidence 0.6.
Multiply news_pct_30min and news_pct_120min to favor consistent moves. SUGGESTION1 used two fields with strong coverage. Confidence 0.63.

results.idea: Momentum adjusted for ticks per volume
results.description: Divide pct_10min by (tot_ticks / curr_vol) approximated via multiply: divide(news_pct_10min, divide(news_tot_ticks, news_curr_vol)). To keep <=2 datafields limit, implement simpler ratio pct_10min / tot_ticks. Confidence 0.47.
Multiply atr_ratio by vol_stddev to emphasize volatile breakouts: multiply(news_atr_ratio, news_vol_stddev). Both high coverage; SUGGESTION4 satisfied. Confidence 0.6.
Compare eps actual to recent 30-min move: divide(news_eps_actual, news_pct_30min). Both high coverage; good SUGGESTION4. Confidence 0.62.
If minutes until 1% up is large (nws12_mainz_1l high), expect mean reversion: reverse(ts_zscore(nws12_mainz_1l, 20)). Coverage high; simple. Confidence 0.5.
Multiply pre-gap by inverse market cap: divide(news_pre_vwap, news_cap). Two fields, both with decent coverage. Confidence 0.48.
Only act on open_gap when volstddev low: divide(news_open_gap, news_vol_stddev). Both fields >0.6 coverage. Confidence 0.56.
Divide 30-min return by tot_ticks to prefer moves with less microsecond noise: divide(news_pct_30min, news_tot_ticks). Both high coverage. Confidence 0.49.
Multiply eps actual by 1-min move to capture immediate persistence: multiply(news_eps_actual, news_pct_1min). Both strong fields. Confidence 0.68.
ts_zscore(news_pct_10min, 15) to standardize early reaction. Coverage good; no backfill needed. Confidence 0.61.
Reverse extreme news_mins_20_chg signal: reverse(ts_zscore(news_mins_20_chg, 30)). Field coverage >0.9 for mainz variants; used that to ensure stability. Confidence 0.6.
Multiply pct_60min by tot_ticks: multiply(news_pct_60min, news_tot_ticks). Both high coverage. Confidence 0.52.
Divide max_up_ret by mov_vol to highlight impactful moves: divide(news_max_up_ret, news_mov_vol). Both high coverage; SUGGESTION4 applied. Confidence 0.57.
Reverse ts_zscore(news_pct_30sec, 5) for micro reversal. Coverage high; simple operators. Confidence 0.59.
Divide short return by pe_ratio to prefer cheap momentum: divide(news_pct_30min, news_pe_ratio). Both strong coverage. Confidence 0.54.
Divide open_gap by tot_ticks to prefer genuine gaps: divide(news_open_gap, news_tot_ticks). Both fields high coverage. Confidence 0.47.
ts_zscore(news_pct_5_min, 15) standardized. Coverage ~0.332 so applied ts_backfill per SUGGESTION3 to improve robustness. Confidence 0.46.
Divide eps_actual by vol_stddev to find quiet stock earnings movers: divide(news_eps_actual, news_vol_stddev). Both fields high coverage. Confidence 0.65.
Reverse strong stock index divergence: reverse(ts_zscore(news_indx_perf, 10)). Field high coverage. Confidence 0.58.
Divide short return by market cap to prefer small-cap continuation: divide(news_pct_10min, news_cap). Both fields high coverage. Confidence 0.55.
Subtract low_exc_stddev from high_exc_stddev to capture asymmetry: subtract(news_high_exc_stddev, news_low_exc_stddev). Both high coverage. Confidence 0.6.
Divide news_pct_30min by news_atr_ratio to normalize by recent range: divide(news_pct_30min, news_atr_ratio). Both fields high coverage. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Momentum filtered by previous close move
results.description: Multiply prev_day_ret with immediate pct_1min: multiply(news_prev_day_ret, news_pct_1min). Both fields coverage good; prev_close low coverage omitted. Confidence 0.6.
Reverse minutes-elapsed before 1% up (nws12_mainz_01l): reverse(ts_zscore(nws12_mainz_01l, 30)). High coverage. Confidence 0.58.

Multiply difference between eod_close and main_vwap with indx_perf: multiply(subtract(news_eod_close, news_main_vwap), news_indx_perf). To respect <=2 datafields, use eod_close and indx_perf only. Confidence 0.46.
Reverse large curr_vol relative to mov_vol: reverse(divide(news_curr_vol, news_mov_vol)). Both fields high coverage and userCount. Confidence 0.53.

results.idea: Short-term mean reversion by range stddev
results.description: Reverse ts_zscore(news_range_stddev, 30) to fade extreme range expansion. Field coverage ~0.617 so no backfill required. Confidence 0.56.
Multiply tot_ticks with atr_ratio to find explosive moves: multiply(news_tot_ticks, news_atr_ratio). Both high coverage. Confidence 0.52.
Multiply eps_actual by inverse pe_ratio approximated via divide: divide(news_eps_actual, news_pe_ratio). Strong coverage on both; SUGGESTION4 applied. Confidence 0.67.
Divide news_pct_90min by news_mov_vol to emphasize moves in low-liquidity names: divide(news_pct_90min, news_mov_vol). Both high coverage. Confidence 0.55.

results.idea: Pre-open gap fade when low vol
results.description: Reverse open_gap when volstddev low: reverse(divide(news_open_gap, news_vol_stddev)). Both >0.6 coverage. Confidence 0.56.
Multiply pct_5_min and pct_30min for consistency signal: multiply(news_pct_5_min, news_pct_30min). Coverage for pct_5_min low (~0.332) so used ts_backfill per SUGGESTION3. Confidence 0.49.
Reverse pct_10min scaled by cap: reverse(divide(news_pct_10min, news_cap)). Both fields have good coverage; cap high userCount. Confidence 0.52.
zscore(news_pct_1min) to pick extreme immediate reactions. Single field, high coverage. Confidence 0.6.
Divide result_vs_index by volstddev to normalize: divide(news_indx_perf, news_vol_stddev). Both fields high coverage. Confidence 0.58.
Multiply pct_1min by tot_ticks to favor strong micro moves: multiply(news_pct_1min, news_tot_ticks). Both high coverage. Confidence 0.5.

results.idea: Earnings momentum per cap and vol
results.description: Divide eps_actual by market cap to find impactful earnings: divide(news_eps_actual, news_cap). Both high coverage. Confidence 0.64.
Reverse ts_zscore(news_rangestddev, 30). Coverage ~0.624 so chosen without backfill; KEEP_IN_MIND satisfied. Confidence 0.57.
Multiply prevday return with immediate pct_5_min: multiply(news_prev_day_ret, news_pct_5_min). prev_day_ret coverage high; pct_5_min lower so used ts_backfill per SUGGESTION3. Confidence 0.5.
High short_interest with low volstddev can prime squeezes: divide(news_short_interest, news_vol_stddev). Both fields high coverage. Confidence 0.53.

results.idea: Immediate move scaled by eod_vwap gap
results.description: Divide pct_1min by difference to eod_vwap: divide(news_pct_1min, subtract(news_eod_close, news_eod_vwap)). To respect <=2 datafields, use pct_1min and eod_vwap only. Confidence 0.45.
Reverse minutes-to-1pct down (nws12_mainz_01s): reverse(ts_zscore(nws12_mainz_01s, 30)). High coverage. Confidence 0.52.
Multiply ratio_vol by atr_ratio to emphasize volume-driven breakouts: multiply(news_ratio_vol, news_atr_ratio). Both fields moderate-to-high coverage. Confidence 0.5.
Divide eps_actual by tot_ticks to highlight earnings on low-activity names: divide(news_eps_actual, news_tot_ticks). Both fields high coverage. Confidence 0.49.
zscore(news_opengap) to identify extreme pre-open gaps. Coverage ~0.707 for mainx variants; used main where available. Confidence 0.55.
Multiply pct_30min by tot_ticks to select high conviction moves: multiply(news_pct_30min, news_tot_ticks). Both fields high coverage. Confidence 0.51.
Reverse minutes-to-3% up to prioritize fast rallies: reverse(ts_zscore(nws12_mainz_3l, 30)). Coverage high. Confidence 0.54.
Reverse(subtract(news_eod_close, news_eod_vwap)) to fade large deviations from VWAP. Both fields high coverage. Confidence 0.6.
Multiply max_dn_ret by vol_stddev to detect pressured continuations: multiply(news_max_dn_ret, news_vol_stddev). Both fields high coverage. Confidence 0.5.
ts_zscore(news_tot_ticks, 20) to find unusual tick activity predicting moves. High coverage and userCount. Confidence 0.52.
Multiply pct_30min by inverse PE approximated via divide: divide(news_pct_30min, news_pe_ratio). Both high coverage. Confidence 0.53.
Reverse(ts_zscore(news_eps_actual, 20)) to fade extreme reported EPS when market overreacts. Field coverage high; SUGGESTION4 supports eps field. Confidence 0.61.
Multiply pct_60min by curr_vol to prefer high-volume continuations: multiply(news_pct_60min, news_curr_vol). Both fields >0.6 coverage. Confidence 0.52.
Multiply highexcstddev by pct_5_min to find confirmed breakouts: multiply(news_high_exc_stddev, news_pct_5_min). pct_5_min lower coverage so ts_backfill applied. Confidence 0.48.
Reverse short_interest zscore: reverse(ts_zscore(news_short_interest, 30)) to fade extreme borrowing pressure that may have mean-reverted. Coverage high. Confidence 0.5.

results.idea: Momentum scaled by ticks per vol
results.description: Divide pct_10min by vol_ratio to prefer moves with meaningful volume: divide(news_pct_10min, news_ratio_vol). Both fields moderate coverage. Confidence 0.48.
Compute LS-style asymmetry via news_ls proxy: zscore(news_ls). news_ls coverage ~0.488 so applied ts_backfill per SUGGESTION3. Confidence 0.42 due to low coverage.
